org.cougaar.core.component
Interface StateObject

All Known Subinterfaces:
Binder, ContainerBinder
All Known Implementing Classes:
Agent, AgentImpl, AgentManager, BinderBase, BinderSupport, BinderWrapper, ContainedBinderSupport, ContainerBinderSupport, ContainerSupport, DomainManager, MessageTransportServiceProvider, Node, NodeAgent, PluginManager, PluginSanityBinder.Enforcer, ResolverContainer, RSSMetricsServiceProvider, ServerContainer, ServiceFilterBinder, SimpleAgent
public interface StateObject

An Object that contains internal state.

Component mobility and persistence requires the saving and restoration of internal Component state. The typical lifecycle for both scenarios is:

  1. The Component is asked for it's state
  2. The Component is destroyed
  3. A new instance of the Component is created from a ComponentDescription. The new location might be on a different host.
  4. The state is passed to the StateComponent

All Containers are StateComponents because (minimally) they contain a tree of child Components.

Binders act as proxies for the child state-saving.

This interface might be removed in the future and replaced with reflective method-lookup, similar to BindingUtility.

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object getState()
          Get the current state of the Component that is sufficient to reload the Component from a ComponentDescription.
 void setState(java.lang.Object o)
          Set-state is called by the parent Container if the state is non-null.
 

Method Detail

getState

java.lang.Object getState()
Get the current state of the Component that is sufficient to reload the Component from a ComponentDescription.

Returns:
null if this Component currently has no state

setState

void setState(java.lang.Object o)
Set-state is called by the parent Container if the state is non-null.

The state Object is whatever this StateComponent provided in it's getState() implementation.
